newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL share index ends up 1.57 pct as blue chips rise.
newsitem.headline: KL share index ends up 1.57 pct as blue chips rise.

text.p: Blue chips, led by Malayan Banking (Maybank), surged on renewed institutional buying, pushing the key market index up 1.57 percent at the close, dealers said.
The Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange's Composite Index ended at 1,122.82, up 17.38 points.
Second liners, however, took a breather after several days of sharp advances, with the Second Board index closing up a mere 0.16 point at 506.43.
"It's the blue chips turn to take centre stage, thanks to Maybank," said one institutional dealer.

Maybank jumped 1.40 ringgit to 23.90 on volume of 1.86 million shares, after announcing higher-than-expected full-year earnings. Dealers said the absence of huge write-off of loans to troubled companies Perwaja Steel and Amcol Holdings as rumoured in the market also brought investors back into the stock.
Other blue chip gainers included Genting which rose 30 cents to 18.70 and volume-leader Sime Darby, up 10 cents to 8.00.
Market volume was 219 million shares. Gainers outnumbered losers 413 to 171.
Spot month Composite Index futures closed up 17.9 points at 1,117.4. -- Syed Azman (603-230 8911)
